Ever wonder why March, April, May, and June aren't known as the best time of the year? Because it is not the best time of the year. Spring is a time of restlessness and unease. The general mood of people decreases during the spring months. Most people are grouchy and sour without even realizing it. There are many reasons as to why this happens each year. One of the major reasons is because spring is seen as a time of renewal and rebirth, yet people feel the same. They don't feel renewed or reborn. They feel like it is just another day, which leads them to feel let down. Most of this takes place subconciously and sometimes can even go unnoticed by anyone at all. Other times, however, it is a very external and even physical for people. People are working the rust off their yard work skills which most would prefer to have left behind. Spring cleaning is absorbing energy and time as well, though it's proven by survey that no more cleaning takes place in the spring than any other time of the year. Throughout the year, there are always changes and adjustments everyone must make to continue on. This is definitely not true only to spring. Why then is spring such an unhappy time for most people? Is it an exceptionally transitional time? Are people just bored? Well, maybe. But I think it's more of something rooted into human instinct that was burried, but did not go quietly that still brings this out in us each year. Interesting, yes?
